noun.description: The tough central part of various fruits, containing the seeds.
examples: quarter the pears, remove the cores then slice again into wedges

noun.description: The central or most important part of something.
The dense central region of a planet, especially the nickel–iron inner part of the earth.
Denoting or relating to a figure for inflation that excludes certain items, chiefly food and energy, that are subject to sudden and temporary price fluctuations.
examples: core inflation was up 2.3 percent over the 12 month period

verb.description: Remove the tough central part and seeds from (a fruit)

phrases: she was shaken to the core by his words
I really feel for the Dutch people, and know that this murder must have shaken them to the core.
After the last note faded away, the audience was still, shaken to the core.
Two years ago last week, Standard Life Bank arrived on the scene and shook the banking market to the core.
The information from Boston about his ancestor had shaken him to the core.
